website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight sleeping bag that helps keep you warm and cushioned for a comfortable night's sleep.
pros: Suitable for use in temperatures as low as -20ºF
Attached hood to help keep your head warm
Fluffy enough that you don't need to use a sleeping bag pad with it
cons: Some users say that the zipper is cheap and difficult to use

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: I have had - 20 bags that felt warmer at 3x the cost. This bag I use for camping not backpacking, Because it's pretty big and weighs a bit. For warmth and value this bag is hard to beat though, could you survive -20 in this bag .....maybe....low teens and you should have a good night's sleep though.
customer_reviews.author: troy

customer_reviews.title: Sleep through 20f on a hunting trip, woke up ...
customer_reviews.text: Sleep through 20f on a hunting trip, woke up sweating even, very well insulated, zipper came undone while crawling in at night and takes a bit to get it back together, would be 5 stars if the zipper stayed together, I'm 6'4" 240lbs and had some room left with the tall
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Both my fiance and I have this style, she has a regular and I have a long and we love both of them. I have yet to use the bag in sub zero temperatures. However, I have used it below freezing, and it kept me very warm. The bag is also extremely comfortable, and the zipper hasn't jammed. Like others have said, it is definitely not a backpacking bag as it is huge! However, for the price its an extremely good bag. I'm six feet tall so I decided to go with the long bag, but I can fit in the regular length too.
customer_reviews.author: McKee

customer_reviews.title: Its not the most amazing, expensive bag out there but its got a ...
customer_reviews.text: This this is so cozy. Its not the most amazing, expensive bag out there but its got a great loft to it and would probably suit anyone down to 0 degrees somewhat comfortably. If someone knows what they are doing then they could handle -20 in it with multiple layers of clothes and such. It just barely fits in a large sea to summit compression sack but once its in, it fits nicely. A large may be a better option to allow for long term storage loft and color match
customer_reviews.author: Jared Wallace

customer_reviews.title: fluffy and great for car camping
customer_reviews.text: Warm, fluffy and great for car camping. Definitely does not pack down small enough for backpacking, but for a cheap sleeping bag that you don't need to be portable, you can't go wrong! I really liked how plush the head area was; I didn't need a pillow to sleep comfortably. To get maximum warmth, always pair a sleeping bag with a sleeping pad of some sort. That's where you're going to lose the most heat.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Cheep Zipper
customer_reviews.text: The blanket nice and warm on one side at a time, the zipper is so cheaply manufactured that I will never even work once but if you keep waking up every hour or so and spinning a bag around to your other side you can even out the Heat.
customer_reviews.author: Todd H.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bag, Zipper Quality Is The Only Caution
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, definitely keeps me warm as I tend to be cold at night no matter the season. Love the thickness and warmth combined. Extremely comfortable. I took one star off for the zipper. I wish the zipper were a bit more heavy duty. I always fear that it's going to break off because it's smaller than my more expensive bags.
customer_reviews.author: S. Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Not -20
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not for extreme weather. I use it inside an insulated hut at 30 degrees, and was almost cold. Also, it ripped when opening it, and the zippers were a pain to figure out, then they broke completely on the second use. Now I have a warm blanket for around the house.
customer_reviews.author: C.J. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Good sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: Got this sleeping bag for my 8 year old son who likes to go with me on scouting over nighters. He was always cold with the last sleeping bag. So far so good. I like the material of this bag better than my cabelas brand. However the zipper is smaller than my cabelas. All in all I like this one for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Jwclaw

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality zipper
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag was warm and met our winter camping needs while out at Standing Rock but after a 10 -day camping trip the zipper broke rendering it quite useless.
customer_reviews.author: tonya lemos

customer_reviews.title: Stays nice and cozy when temp's get into the low teens ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son who is in the Scouts and we do a lot of winter camping here in the Rockies of Colorado. Stays nice and cozy when temp's get into the low teens and below. Easy to pack up in a compression bag, a little heavy for a 12 year old but he is a Scout.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag. My son has used it camping with the Boy Scouts many times, even in January at -8 in northern Wisconsin in a Quincy, (a type of snow shelter) It's a little warm for summer camping but he uses it anyway. He's used if for cave camping and it got quite muddy/dirty and it cleaned up very well with just a damp towel. It's seems to be very durable and I bought a second one for my other son. I'd recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Fam Man

customer_reviews.title: With a good one person winter tent and a good pad this ...
customer_reviews.text: Have camped many times in the Wind Rivers of Wyoming during the coldest time of year. With a good one person winter tent and a good pad this bag did the job. It is bulky for packing in but if your not weight sensitive it can be done. great bag, with a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Nice warm comfy bag.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to go camping. It was unexpectedly cold, but it kept me toasty-warm. I'm going to buy another for my wife, who froze all night and had to switch bags! My only complaint would be that it packs down a little large to hike with.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Clouston

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfy on the coldest nights.
customer_reviews.text: If you like to hike the Rockies and camp at high altitudes during cold nights, this is the best sleeping bag for your money. It keeps you warm on the coldest nights. If you're crazy enough to do winter snow camps with a Boy Scout troop, it is essential.
customer_reviews.author: Basil J. Gilger

customer_reviews.title: Mummy for those cold nights
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Thick and warm -Good price -Drawstring to tighten the hood portion around your head Cons: -Left handed (price of getting it for a steal) -Wish the foot box has a zipper access -Not a compact sleeping bag...not for backpacking
customer_reviews.author: xeduck

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable bag down to about 40 degrees
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable bag down to about 40 degrees. I would not trust this bag at 10 degrees or lower. Wanted to send back but way to much work plus works well in fall weather. THIS IS NOT A REAL-20 BAG.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My wife stayed warm
customer_reviews.text: For the first time ever my wife woke up on a cold night camping and said she stayed warm all night. Great price! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: VERY warm bag!
customer_reviews.text: SUPER warm sleeping bag! This bag does not roll up compact, so it's not great for backpacking. I use it for tent and car camping, and it's served me well. Good quality, and extra warm!
customer_reviews.author: Annie Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Toasty warm!
customer_reviews.text: I live at 8000 feet elevation and often camp out at 11,000 feet elevation. This product is perfect as well as other slumber Jack sleeping bags that I have bought over the past several decades.
customer_reviews.author: t f

customer_reviews.title: This thing is big!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a hiking/work trip in the high Andes. I haven’t used it yet but I was a bit surprised by how much room this thing takes up. It should keep me warm though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice sleeping bag out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice sleeping bag out of the box. I did not however get to use it. While checking out the product I found that the zipper was defective. Returned to Amazon and awaiting refund. Returns with Amazon are very simple and do not for see a problem. **Would like to note that I have a Teton Explorer Sport 4000 65L backpack. I was not looking to keep this in the sleeping bag compartment but I would like to add that if you are planning to keep this bag in there it will probably not fit, even if compressed. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: I am super pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am super pleased with this product! Don't waste money on a cheap sleeping bag. You want to have a good warm one.This one has an adjustable hood which makes a big difference if you are person who gets cold easily. Very good quality of fabric, doesn't make you sweat. Puffy and comfy. I don't know how I would had survived cold camping nights if I didn't have this.
customer_reviews.author: PINAR DURGUN

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Kept me warm at 35 degree at Yosemite, actually too warm
customer_reviews.author: Fico

customer_reviews.title: We like the bag it keeps us warm just hard to ...
customer_reviews.text: With any -degree bags you have to deal with the bulky. We like the bag it keeps us warm just hard to pack and carry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Real nice bag.
customer_reviews.text: Real nice bag... not 5 star because the carry case it comes with does not work once you take out the sleeping bag. Would have paid a few more bucks if it included a functional carry bag.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Recinos

customer_reviews.title: This was a great purchase so far
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase so far. My 260 lb, 6"2' husband has only used it 3 times and loved it. He didn't feel cramped at all.
customer_reviews.author: cth

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Warm for winter camping New England style. Toasty sleeping at 0 degrees Will buy another for family member Highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Angela C

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son-in-law and he loved it! He used it this winter when it was quite cold outside and said it kept him so warm he was sweating. The extra length was good for his large, 6-ft frame.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L. Summers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice keep me warmed and a lot space, thank you
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Will keep you warm even naked
customer_reviews.text: Great bag if you don't have to hike in to a camp spot. My only real complaint is that the zipper snags easily.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: It s a nice sleeping bag. Just was still very cold in it. 4 stars because I don't want to blame my coldness solely on the sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: This bag is well-made and kept me warm on a ...
customer_reviews.text: This bag is well-made and kept me warm on a 0 degree night during a windy snow-storm! Slumberjack sacrifices weight for warmth + price with this product. It's so bulky that I can't believe I lost the darn thing after one night of use :P
customer_reviews.author: Rip

customer_reviews.title: So far looks like it will work great
customer_reviews.text: So far looks like it will work great. Some friends have the same bag and it keeps them nice and warm. Have a winter camp coming up, so let's hope so.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy L. Munro

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Would've been 5 stars but the zipper on the bag punctured my Coleman air bed. Maybe it was a fluke, maybe not. This bag is a great value compared to other -20 bags. It's comfortable and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: WooHoo! Hot Hot Hot! I camped in 20 deg weather through a wind storm and sweated the whole night
customer_reviews.author: Paul L.

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: My husband and son go camping with Boy Scouts and stay warm in this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Housewife

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: We spent the night in a tent at -10 F with strong winds. The bag has great features and value.
customer_reviews.author: My2Cents

customer_reviews.title: Really good sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is good quality, and warm! You can sleep out in the 40,s as well as single digits! Haven't tried it out in - temps yet though.
customer_reviews.author: survival boy

customer_reviews.title: its huge. its warm. tested in -8F.
customer_reviews.text: very good quality. especially for a sub $100 sleeping bag that is rated that low (-20F). i took this camping while it was -8F outside. i was very warm and toasty. i slept like a baby wearing basic thermals on top and bottom. the only CONs are: -its really big. REALLY big. its 6lbs. as a result, this is more of a car camping sleeping bag. can you carry it backpacking? SURE YOU CAN. but you better be willing to carry 6lb sleeping bag and your backpack should be at least 80L. i have a teton fox5200 (85L total) and it was a VERY tight squeeze. -its really hard to roll it back into its sleeping bag pouch.
customer_reviews.author: James V.

customer_reviews.title: Defective zipper
customer_reviews.text: Took out of bag to try before trip, zipper keep snagging on material and then separated unable to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Very warm and soft in sub zero environment. Loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Kumar

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I slept on the glacier, -10 degrees, very warm,for hiking very difficult, big size.
customer_reviews.author: gocha

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag that kept me very warm at temperatures around ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag that kept me very warm at temperatures around 0 degrees. Zipper is somewhat difficult to pull shut but manageable. Great, warm bag for a real good price.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you very warm!
customer_reviews.text: HOT BAG. Keeps you plenty warm on a few winter nights in a forest service cabin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazons best customer

customer_reviews.title: A good mummy bag, even if the zipper is finicky at times.
customer_reviews.text: Those who say they used this sleeping bag in 20 to 30 degree weather, yet were cold, didn't use the bag properly. I have used this bag in sub 20 degree temps, and it is warm. Minus 20? I dont expect the exact same results at that temperature, but down to 0, that should be no problem for you. The zipper could use a little reengineering, and the manufacturer would do well to listen to seasoned Amazon shoppers on this. Overall the product is a great value. The quality is good, the performance is just right, and the price is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: This sleeping bag was perfect. My son slept in it for nights after ...
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag was perfect. My son slept in it for nights after we gave it to him. He's looking forward to using it outside this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Krista B

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: just right for my son who is a boy scout leader
customer_reviews.author: ZoAnn

customer_reviews.title: but this one is good for car camping
customer_reviews.text: needed a more backpacking sleeping bag, but this one is good for car camping!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P. Brong

customer_reviews.title: Works for +20 degree and above
customer_reviews.text: This bag is OK for car camping as long as the temp is 20 degrees or above. I tried it out last night when the temps dropped to 16 degrees (no wind). It worked fine at midnight when the temp was 20 degrees, but by morning it had dropped to 16 and the bag was barely warm enough. It seems difficult to draw the bag up tightly around the head / face area, which allows cold air into the bag. For other, more expensive bags I have used in the past, this has not been a problem. So, I was disappointed that it would not work for lower temps, but for the money it will serve my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: GA Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: gift for grand son but was too small!!!! Hes a TALL kid but we worked things out!!!!! Tks
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Moore

customer_reviews.title: A real bargain
customer_reviews.text: Bag arrived promptly.Has sack for storage. Very comfortable. Slides around as would be expected given material. Zipper problems when zipper gets too close to bottom.
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for someone whom isn't worried about space consumption.
customer_reviews.text: Its VERY big/thick. When it comes to backpacking. Its huge. But to be honest I never spend more than one night when winter camping, so long distance-backpacking/baggage efficiency/compression isn't very important when it comes to this bag. Its perfect for car camping etc. NOT BACKPACKING/HIKING. Don't let that deter you from a good sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: great bag for less
customer_reviews.text: Climbed a Colorado 14er spent the night near the summit with this bag; no tent just the bag it passed the test.
customer_reviews.author: Blanca Eccher

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Zipper gets caught in some spots but stayed nice and toasty warm in cold, winter weather.
customer_reviews.author: Shayne

customer_reviews.title: ... bag in zero degree weather and it kept me Super warm.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this bag in zero degree weather and it kept me Super warm.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Buck

customer_reviews.title: Warm!
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag worked really well camping in the Aleutian Islands with lows in the low 30s and upper 20s. I was toasty warm.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: Warm, but very bulky
customer_reviews.text: Like all sleeping bags, the temperature rating is not 'true'. You will be cold if you sleep in PJs in this bag at -20F. My son used this for a camp out where is was around 20F and was very comfortable. From my camping experiences over the years I would say ratings are about 20F off. But that's just me. This is a very reasonably priced sleeping bag. But with lower end bags you gain weight and bulk, this is not a backpacking bag.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Roberts

customer_reviews.title: great bag....not so great zipper
customer_reviews.text: First let me say this is a great sleeping bag, I am a big guy and i bought the long very and it was spacious and comfortable. My own gripes would have to be that the zip can be somewhat problematic catching on the material and this makes getting in and out a little frustrating. Kept me very warm and was comfortable though.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Longhurst

customer_reviews.title: Big and bulky good luck finding a compression bag for it to fit ...
customer_reviews.text: Big and bulky good luck finding a compression bag for it to fit in it is not a backpacking sleeping bag as advertised who knows if the temperature is true
customer_reviews.author: jim lillie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: its a nice bag and keeps you warm in freezing conditions
customer_reviews.author: E. Lektrishun

customer_reviews.title: It looks like it will keep my Boy Scout warm
customer_reviews.text: We have yet to test this sleeping bag. It looks like it will keep my Boy Scout warm. I did some research on it. However, it is not a bag that I would go hiking with as it is bulky and heavy (not ideal to strap to a pack), but would be sufficient in carrying on a winter campout in a tent.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Black

customer_reviews.title: Large, warm, and heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Good, heavy, warm bag. Not for backpacking. Too large and heavy. Great bag, otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: SLUMBERJACK SLEEPING BAG
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A GREAT BAG FOR THE MONEY, WELL CONSTRUCTED AND WARM . ANY -20 BAG COSTS FAR MORE AND NOT AS WELL MADE. I HAVE HAD ENOUGH TO BE ABLE TO MAKE THIS COMPARISON. I WILL BUY ANOTHER .
customer_reviews.author: BULL DOG

customer_reviews.title: Fix the zipper
customer_reviews.text: Sleeping bag was well made and provided for a warm night, however would have kept me warmer if the zipper wasn't getting caught in the bag everytime I opened and closed it!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Melville

customer_reviews.title: Very good and warm
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. I'm waiting to test it really on my next mountain adventure
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Zambrano

customer_reviews.title: -20 degree sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: I have bought well over a hundred items from Amazon over the years and this was the worst purchase I can think of. I was camping with a low temp of about 25-28 degrees. I tightened up the sleeping bag with both draw cords as tight as I could and still was cold.I have a Coleman sleeping bag rated at 10 degrees that is as warm as this one. I am very disappointed .
customer_reviews.author: LJK

customer_reviews.title: It's annoying when your tired and sleepy
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I have with this bag,is the zipper.It snags the material every time I try zipper it up or down.It's annoying when your tired and sleepy.Other than that,I think the bag is well made and feels good against your body.When fully zippered,you are very warm and comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Noll

customer_reviews.title: Not sure it lives up to Minus 20 rating
customer_reviews.text: I use this sometimes when I'm traveling. It's definitly pretty warm but I found I needed a fleece blanket and winter hat and jacket or sweater to stay warm when its even when its in the high teens. I don't think it would keep you warm enough at -20
customer_reviews.author: Jack Torrance

customer_reviews.title: Good Bag for the money
customer_reviews.text: One thing to note is that degree rating is off. At 10F you will need to wear heavy layers of outer cholthing. The bag is lighter then other rated in the same degree rating. The real temputure range that a person would find the bag to there liking is around 30F. So don't expect it to work in the -20F/-29C range!
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Langley

customer_reviews.title: A Little Tight
customer_reviews.text: The sleeping bag cover is cheaply made and rips easily. The sleeping bag is also tight leaving not much room to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Rocko

product_meta.title: Slumberjack Latitude -20 Degree Synthetic Sleeping Bag
product_meta.description: 51723011RR Size: Regular Features: -Shell and lining fabric: Polyester taffeta. -Flip over hood allows user to flip the hood for the option of a flat or contoured hood. -Draft collar prevents heat loss from neck and shoulder area. -Anti-snag zipper protection. Product Type: -Sleeping Bag. Best Use: -Recreational Camping. Gender: -Adult Unisex. Shape: -Mummy. Temperature Range: -3-Season, 10-35 degrees. Compression Sack Included: -Yes. Generic Dimensions: -Regular dimensions: 82" W x 32" D. -Long dimensions: 86" W x 34" D. -32-34" H x 82-86" W x 32-34" D.
feature_bullets: Shell Fabric: 100% Polyester Liner Fabric: 100% Polyester Insulation Type: 100% Polyester Fiber
Two-layer, off-set construction and differential cut prevents cold spots
Flip Over Hood allows user to flip the hood inside out for the option of a flat hood or contoured hood
